page.title: 05School
page.content: Blackford Church of England Voluntary Aided Primary School is the only school located in this area. The children at the school are drawn from a wide area. A School has been on the site since 1831 and during the time of this survey it has undergone extensive repairs. As the school is Voluntary Aided the Governors have to find a proportion of total cost of 26000 pounds amounting to a little over 6000 pounds. The school has 42 pupils and 2 full time and 1 part-time teachers. The school opens at 9.00p.m. and closes at 3.30p.m. One hour is taken for lunch and the school meals are prepared on the site. Children transfer from this school when they are eleven and go to schools either in Carlisle or Longtown.
